title: Carlton Davis gives his pitch for free agents to join Patriots this offseason
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Carlton Davis praises Patriots' culture and management under coach Vrabel, encouraging free agents to join the team.
New England Patriots, with ample salary cap space, draw free agent interest after securing a Super Bowl appearance.
High-profile free agents like George Pickens and Jaelan Phillips could enhance the Patriots' roster in the offseason.

title: Where does Milton Williams rank among Patriots’ 10 best free-agent signings ever?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Milton Williams ranked eighth among the Patriots' top 10 best free-agent signings in franchise history.
Williams signed a four-year, $104 million deal with $63 million guaranteed in 2025.
Williams achieved 5.5 sacks during regular season and postseason, helping the Patriots reach Super Bowl LX.

title: 8 lesser discussed potential trade deadline candidates that could make sense for Celtics
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Celtics are unlikely to pursue major trades but may target supporting players before Thursday's deadline.
Potential candidates include Nets' Nic Claxton and Mavericks' Daniel Gafford, focusing on improving the Celtics' interior defense.
Other candidates like Kings' Keon Ellis and Pelicans' Yyves Missi offer different strengths, such as shooting and shot-blocking.

title: Something in the Way Fest 2026: Live updates from Roadrunner
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Something in the Way Fest 2026 features indie and alt-rock bands at Roadrunner in Boston on Jan. 31 and Feb. 1.
Concert highlights include performances from Angel Du$t and Tigers Jaw, promoting upcoming album 'Lost on You' at the festival.
Brooklyn band Momma donates merchandise sales to Immigrant Law Center of Minnesota during the festival.

title: Why the Bruins practiced in a tent on Saturday in Florida
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Bruins practiced in a tent at Raymond James Stadium to keep ice conditions favorable for an outdoor game.
The NHL built a 34-foot high, 125-foot wide, and 240-foot long tent to preserve the ice for the stadium series.
Temperatures at the game are expected to be in the 30s, colder than the 2023 Winter Classic at Fenway Park.

title: Boston ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest must-see moments
author: Annie Jonas and Samantha Genzer
bullets: Thousands gathered in Boston Common for the 'ICE Out Everywhere' protest, opposing collaboration with U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement.
The protest was part of a nationwide campaign in over 300 cities, inspired by recent deaths linked to ICE actions.
Organizers called for nonviolent resistance and criticized increased ICE actions, including Operation Patriot 2.0 in Massachusetts.

title: Photos from Boston’s ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Over a thousand protesters gathered at Boston Common to oppose Trump's immigration policies on January 31, 2026.
The 'ICE Out Everywhere' protest, supported by Mass 50501, is part of a national series of demonstrations.
Participants, including Somerville's Good Trouble Brass Band, braved 15-degree weather following a snowstorm.

title: Insider believes Red Sox have ‘another move in them’ this offseason to improve infield
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox may pursue another infielder before the 2026 season, according to ESPN insider Jeff Passan.
Potential targets include Isaac Paredes from Houston, but the Astros don't need to trade him yet.
Boston has also checked in on Cubs' Nico Hoerner, but Cubs are unlikely to trade him.

title: Even Drake Maye’s dad is surprised by Patriots’ Super Bowl run
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Drake Maye led the New England Patriots to Super Bowl LX, despite preseason expectations being low after consecutive 4-13 seasons.
Maye's father, Mark Maye, expressed surprise at the Patriots' Super Bowl run, though he anticipated a playoff berth.
Drake Maye's performance declined in the postseason, but the Patriots defeated the Broncos 10-7 in the AFC title game.

title: That guy on TV, Cris Collinsworth, will look familiar to Patriots fans tuning into NBC to watch the Super Bowl
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Cris Collinsworth will call his 53rd Patriots game alongside Mike Tirico during Super Bowl LX on NBC.
Collinsworth has covered five Patriots Super Bowls, including their win over the Seahawks 11 seasons ago.
He has commented on the Patriots' adaptability and Mike Vrabel's coaching similar to past dynasty years.
